item.title: Reflections on a year of grad school
item.description: I'm no wiser than last year, but at least I know a few more things.
item.author: Clayton Ramsey

item.title: Making robots plan faster with SIMD and Rust
item.description: Systems programming and data structures meet to make instant collision-checking.
item.author: claytonwramsey@gmail.com (Clayton Ramsey)

item.title: Things I learned from teaching
item.description: This spring, I taught an undergraduate class on chess engines. I probably learned more than any of my students.
item.author: claytonwramsey@gmail.com (Clayton Ramsey)

item.title: Writing my own damn HTML
item.description: The future of the web doesn't have to be webapp frameworks and cookie prompts.
item.author: claytonwramsey@gmail.com (Clayton Ramsey)

item.title: One line of code cost me 9.2% of my matches
item.description: I can either write a hundred lines of code for one or two Elo or find one or two wrong lines of code for a hundred Elo. Such is life.
item.author: claytonwramsey@gmail.com (Clayton Ramsey)

item.title: I built a garbage collector for a language that doesn't need one
item.description: If carcinization happens when languages evolve to be more like Rust, then what do you call it when Rust evolves to be more like Java? Caffeination?
item.author: claytonwramsey@gmail.com (Clayton Ramsey)

item.title: Blowing up my compile times for dubious benefits
item.description: The tree of useless optimization yields questionable fruit.
item.author: claytonwramsey@gmail.com (Clayton Ramsey)
